channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tornadoes Strike Nebraska and Iowa, Injuring at Least 5
item.description: At least five people were injured as severe weather destroyed homes. The damage came a day after tornadoes battered other parts of the Midwest.

item.title: Why Gaza Protests on U.S. College Campuses Have Become So Contagious
item.description: Experts say the partisan political context in Washington is a driver behind the spread of protests at American universities even as overseas campuses have stayed relatively calm.

item.title: Activist hedge fund Elliott bets $1 billion on British platinum producer
item.description: The activist hedge fund led by Paul Singer has exposure to almost 33.6 million Anglo American shares via derivatives, per a filing.

item.title: Daimler Truck Workers Reach Deal and Avert Threatened Strike in North Carolina
item.description: The United Automobile Workers reached an agreement involving workers who make Freightliner trucks and Thomas Built buses. The deal comes as the union seeks to expand its membership in southern states.

item.title: Judge in Sept. 11 Case Visits Former C.I.A. Black Site
item.description: Col. Matthew McCall toured the part of the prison at Guantánamo Bay where, in 2007, federal agents obtained now-disputed confessions from terrorism suspects.

item.title: Pottery Barn parent Williams-Sonoma fined for marketing its furniture as 'crafted' in the U.S. when it was actually made in China
item.description: In addition to paying a penalty, the company will be required to submit annual compliance reports, the FTC said.

item.title: Barnard Ends Suspensions for Most Student Protesters Who Were Arrested
item.description: The students had been among more than 100 who were suspended for participating in an encampment at Columbia University.

item.title: He Paid $13 for $13,000 Cartier Earrings, and Then the Jeweler Noticed
item.description: When Rogelio Villarreal bought rose-gold earrings for a price that the luxury retailer said was a mistake, he looked to a Mexican consumer protection law. He later said the company delivered the earrings.

item.title: Philadelphia-based Republic Bank implodes in first failure of the year
item.description: Republic First Bank had roughly $6 billion in assets and $4 billion in deposits as of Jan. 31.

item.title: Paramedic Avoids Prison in Death of Elijah McClain
item.description: The sentencing marked the final chapter of a case that stretched over nearly five years and helped usher in sweeping public safety reforms.

item.title: Police Arrest Rabbis Demanding Cease-Fire at Rally Near Gaza-Israel Border
item.description: A group of about 30 rabbis and peace activists from Israel and the United States was trying to take food supplies into the territory.

item.title: The top 5 books these mental health experts say will help you combat burnout at work and build healthy habits
item.description: What to read when you're feeling overwhelmed at work.

item.title: G.O.P. Asks Secret Service to Move Protesters Away From Convention Venue
item.description: The Republican National Committee said moving protesters farther away from the venue in Milwaukee would reduce the risk of confrontations.

item.title: A Baby Born in Gaza After Her Mother Was Killed Has Died
item.description: The birth of the girl, captured on video, brought a glimmer of hope to war-torn Gaza, but she died of respiratory problems after five days, her uncle said.

item.title: Billionaire Miami Dolphins owner wants South Florida to be more like Manhattan—'I still love a challenge'
item.description: “I want to make West Palm a model city for the country," said Related Cos. founder, Stephen Ross.
